111. ## ğŸ“ Rails Features Demonstrated
112. 
113. ### 1. **Convention over Configuration**
114. Rails follows the principle of "Convention over Configuration". Notice how:
115. - Models are singular (`Todo`)
116. - Controllers are plural (`TodosController`)
117. - Database tables are plural (`todos`)
118. - No XML configuration files needed!
119. 
120. ### 2. **ActiveRecord ORM**
121. The `Todo` model ([app/models/todo.rb](app/models/todo.rb)) demonstrates:
122. - **Validations**: Ensuring data integrity without writing SQL
123. - **Scopes**: Reusable query methods (`.completed`, `.pending`, `.recent`)
124. - **Custom methods**: Business logic encapsulation
125. 
126. ```ruby
127. # Beautiful, readable database queries
128. Todo.completed.recent  # Get all completed todos, ordered by most recent
129. ```
130. 
131. ### 3. **RESTful Routes**
132. Rails uses resourceful routing ([config/routes.rb](config/routes.rb)):
133. ```ruby
134. resources :todos  # Automatically creates 7 standard routes
135. ```
136. 
137. This generates:
138. | HTTP Method | Path | Controller#Action | Purpose |
139. |-------------|------|-------------------|---------|
140. | GET | /todos | todos#index | List all todos |
141. | GET | /todos/new | todos#new | Show form for new todo |
142. | POST | /todos | todos#create | Create a new todo |
143. | GET | /todos/:id | todos#show | Show a specific todo |
144. | GET | /todos/:id/edit | todos#edit | Show form to edit todo |
145. | PATCH/PUT | /todos/:id | todos#update | Update a specific todo |
146. | DELETE | /todos/:id | todos#destroy | Delete a specific todo |
147. 
148. ### 4. **MVC Architecture**
149. Clear separation of concerns:
150. - **Models** ([app/models/](app/models/)): Business logic and data
151. - **Views** ([app/views/](app/views/)): User interface templates
152. - **Controllers** ([app/controllers/](app/controllers/)): Request handling and flow
153. 
154. ### 5. **DRY Principle (Don't Repeat Yourself)**
155. - Partials for reusable view components (`_todo.html.erb`)
156. - Layouts for shared page structure (`application.html.erb`)
157. - Helpers for view logic
158. 
159. ### 6. **Migrations**
160. Database changes are versioned and reversible:
161. ```bash
162. rails db:migrate      # Apply migrations
163. rails db:rollback     # Undo last migration
164. ```
165. 
166. ### 7. **Hotwire/Turbo**
167. Modern, fast user experience without writing JavaScript:
168. - Turbo Drive: Intercepts link clicks for faster navigation
169. - Turbo Frames: Update parts of the page without full reload
170. - Minimal JavaScript needed!
171. 
172. ### 8. **Built-in Helpers**
173. Rails provides helpers that make development easier:
174. - `form_with`: Smart form generation
175. - `link_to`: HTML-safe link generation
176. - `time_ago_in_words`: Human-readable timestamps
177. - `button_to`: RESTful button forms
178. 
179. ### 9. **Asset Pipeline**
180. Organized asset management:
181. - SCSS for CSS preprocessing
182. - Import maps for JavaScript
183. - Bootstrap integration
184.
